intro: Crypsinus albulus, commonly known as the white-flowered cryptostegia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant contains latex sap that is milky and can be irritant to the skin.
